reviewText: In all, a beautiful movie. I wish the plot was more elaborate and the characters more multidimensional. What comes through, though, is the beauty of Havana and Cuba before the revolution, and the love Chico and Rita feel for each other.
summary: Animation and music are great. Plot feels like a soap opera.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Animated.Musical.Cultural.Romance.Adventure.What could go wrong?This movie seemed like the perfect thing to show to all the kids on our monthly youth cultural appreciation night at church.I couldn't of been more wrong.As a father of eleven kids (different mothers) my time is pretty divided, so I try to consolidate my time with them. I'm an aspiring clergy in hopes of obtaining gainful employment. The result is that I spend a considerable amount of time organizing wholesome activities that will inspire the youth of our congregation and community to make good choices.Recently, this past Tuesday was our Cuban-themed night. In searching amazon.com for some movies that might be played as we celebrated Cuba  I came across this one.I couldn't of been more excited, but I was at the Sisters in L. Ron Hubbard Senior Citizen Costume Center so I had to keep my voice down or I would of angered the white-haired ladies. Believe you me, they are not ones to be crossed.Fast forward, I get the movie just in time for Cuban night so I didn't have time to preview it. Big mistake.Chico, is a drunk, womanizing, smoking "man" of the world who rides a motorcycle.Rita,  aspiring singer who earns money on the side in worldly ways that simply are better left unsaid.In-between their bouts of drinking and multiple sexual partners, they somehow manage to find time for each other.It's not till they are in their golden years that they find themselves alone and communism failed that there might be some merit to actually settling down. By then, they are far too old and society has dismissed them to pasture to live out their hollow days.When the movie was over and the kids parents came to pick them up, several of the parents (and even my kids' mothers) were pretty upset with me. I really had no idea, but the church disciplinary council felt that it was best that I not organize any more youth activities or attend them for the foreseeable future until further review.

reviewText: This movie offers a glimpse of the pre-Castro Cuba centered around an animated romance which uses jazz music as a backdrop. The use of non-traditional main characters also makes this movie standout. Great music, too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an animated movie from Oscar winning director Fernando Trueba ( Belle Epoque ) and Spains most successful designer Javier Mariscal , Chico & Rita follows the relationship of two young Cuban musicians who fall in love , Chico is a gifted piano player looking to bring the sound of Havana to New York and Rita is a beautiful singer looking for a way out who treads the precarious path between latin musicians and white investors looking to cash in on the popularity of this new music , like all star crossed lovers they journey is not an easy one - Their musical and Romantic tribulation continues over 60 years agaisnt the striking backdrops of Havana - New York - Paris - Hollywood and Las Vegas set in the late 40's to early 50's feauturing an original sound track by legendary Cuban jazz pianist bandleader & composer Bebo Valdez from Calle 54 with music by Thelonious Monk - Cole Porter - Dizzy Gillespie - Chucho Valdes - Freddy Cole - Bud Powell - Chano Pozzo - Tito Puente - Ben Webster.Music compose & arranged & songs performed by Bebo Valdes as chico Cuban jazz pianist & Idania Valdes as Rita and Estrella Morente as herself - Sound track produce by Fernando Trueba - Additional music & arrangements by Michael P. Mossman .The only problem I had with this Blu Ray when I changed regions from B to A and back to B on both my multi region Players it just wouldn't play the second time : This copy of Chico & Rita is European UK set on B region & played perfect the first time so must be B region locked and had to watch it on my Blu Ray Recorder set only on B Region and played perfect , This animated feature is in Spanish with English subtitles and won best animated film Goya award Feb 2011 - Festival of European Feature Films and TV Specials June 2011 - European Film Awards best animated feature December 2011 also nominated for best animated feature Annie Awards Feb 4th 2012 and nominated for an academy award 26 of Feb 2012 , Great Animated Movie & Sound Track 5 +.

reviewText: This is a great love, adventurous movie. I loved the theme and the characters, specially the music.  Even though is cartoon animated, the movie feels very real from beggining to end.

reviewText: This has become one of my all time favorites.  A simple story but magically animated with a heavy dose of history and an aural, both voice and musically, feast.  It saddens me that I've lent it to friends who kind of tune out once they see it's animated.  Do not make this mistake.  This film validates animation the same way The Artist validated silent films.

reviewText: This is a unique animated film with a sweet little story as well as a homage to Latin Jazz and its musicians in the late 40's and 50's.  it has the best soundtrack on any Jazz film ever.
summary: A must have if you are into Latin Jazz
